name: Magic Circus Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is really nice and its clean the rooms are just what you need for a two child family. There is air con in the rooms with a tele in the main room and one in the bunk bed section which our little girl loved. You dont need to take a hair dryer as they are in every bathroom but you will need shampoo but shower gel is included too and as everyone has mentioned dont drink the tea or coffee in the room as it cost 6euro to replace.
reviews.title: If your on a budget listen up!

reviews.text: The internet is about 22 euro per day so dont bother with that either.
reviews.title: I'm Going to Trash This Hotel -- Warning to All Who Come Here

reviews.text: In reception there has been a lot of people saying the childrens rides cost 2euro per ride well that is true but here's a tip if you dont want to pay control your child and say "no" and lead them to the free ball pool its that simple.
reviews.title: == Ridiculously Overprice Rip off - taking advantage of kiddie holidays ==

reviews.text: The breakfast in the morning is more than enough for anyones taste so im not sure what others who have complained except if you cant find anything from a cooked breakfast,croissants,pain aux chocolat,yoghurts,fruits,toast,meats,eggs,tomatoes,cereals and other stuff then its you who is the problem. It does get busy but hey its a buffet breakfast just go with the flow imo.
reviews.title: Hotel Magic Circus, not 5 * but still a nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also people have complained about the towels at the pool costing 2euros but you just take the towels out of your room and its free you dont have to use the pool towels duh i did not pay once!!! the pool is really good for young children but the main pool gets busy in the evening.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: We stayed here for four days in June with my son who is 1, we stayed here as an alternative to the disney hotels as ap ackage we booked. The hotel is lovely and clean and the grounds outside were nice. Generally as a base for the disney parks it is ok as we didnt spend a great deal of time at the hotel anyway.
reviews.title: ok as a base for disney parks

reviews.text: We found the shuttle to the parks a bit of a nightmare, everyone pushing and no order to it at all, no one seemed to mind pushing my son in his pushchair out of the way either. The only other negative thing was the breakfast buffet which was chaos on a morning, far too busy and the breakfast itself was only ok.
reviews.title: Average 4 star hotel

reviews.text: The beds and rooms were comfortable and clean and we had great time at the disney parks.
reviews.title: Magic Circus Hotel: All that you could wish for and more.....

reviews.text: Hotel is situated on the 'out-skirts' of the Theme Parks and can be reached by a frequent, free shuttle-bus which commutes between the Parks (and train station) and the hotel.
reviews.title: A good option compared to the disney hotels?

reviews.text: Check-in at the was not the fastest due to a mix-up in the reservation voucher. Things were getting complicated for the front-desk girl also due to the poor English she spoke. Calling her superior was her only option and after a few moments everything was settled.The family room consisted of two bunk-beds and a double bed leaving little room for anything else including the suitcases. The room had two TV sets, one for us and one for the children. Only English TV stations were news and sports stations and the only Italian station on the TV menu (RAI Uno) was out-of order. Air-conditioner struggled to cool down the room especially the children's 'compartment'. Free tea/coffee making facilities were available in the room BUT only for the first night!! You can ask for replenishments at a (high) cost. Bathroom was OK.
reviews.title: Great for the price
A place that casts a magic spell!
reviews.text: "Circus" is the theme of the hotel. So it wasn't surprising that my teenage child loved it. The room was quite big with a small enclosure inside for the kid which was complete with a cosy bed and a small TV set.the room overlooked the lush green meadow in the vicinity. The room was very brightly done up like in a circus!

reviews.title: Good experience!
reviews.text: The only drawback is that the breakfast hall was absolutely overcrowded. So we had to wait in long queues to get our breakfast. I think the hotel must do something about this.

reviews.title: Pleasant suprises, great location, helpful staff...and not in the park!
reviews.text: So if you stay at this hotel, then get up early morning and go for your breakfast so that you have some more time to spend at the park.

reviews.title: Great time at Disneyland; hotel adequate.
reviews.text: Like the previous reviewer we too were rather unsettled by some of the earlier negative comments regarding this hotel. However, I wholeheartedly agree with everything he says. We were a party of 9 which included our two grandchildren of 2 and 5 years staying for 3 nights.

reviews.title: Not a good stay.
reviews.text: We experienced several minor problems at the hotel which were handled and resolved speedily and efficiently. We found the reception staff to be friendly and very helpful indeed. The breakfast staff were also pleasant and accommodating and the food was varied and more than adequate.
I just got back from here. I never write reviews but I felt I had to after this trip.
reviews.title: Don't Bother!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seriously, do not bother paying the money out for this place. A family room is 228euro for the night and it is particularly poor for that price. Rather than ramble on I thought it would be interesting to analyse their website wording:
reviews.title: A great hotel to spend a great holiday in!

reviews.text: "The newly renovated 4-star Magic Circus Hotel is ideally situated at Disneyland® Paris, the most popular holiday destination for European families, only 35 minutes from Paris city centre." - If this place is newly renovated than I would have loved to have seen it previously. The place is just a jazzed up Travelodge! The buiilding is completely unremarkable, the inside has got pictures of jugglers plastered to the walls in what is a very very ordinary hotel.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel on the doorstep of disney

reviews.text: "In a green setting and close to the Disney® parks, the hotel lets you experience authentic circus atmosphere. Handsome architectural design evokes an ambiance of circus with its jugglers, clowns and acrobats." - It is in a green setting as it is in a very uncharacteristic and boring setting with lots of grass etc. It is barely in Paris but is near Disney which is why you have to pay through the nose. The architecture has no, literally NO ambience of jugglers etc. There are just pitcures on the walls and nothing else. This is genuinely misleading. Please do not think you're walking into a circus as you will be as disappointed as walking into the Little Chef with a dinner suit on.
reviews.title: Very good hotel - enjoyable stay.

reviews.text: "Be welcomed to the fascinating world of Magic Circus Hotel and enjoy the hospitality of Vienna International Hotels & Resorts." - Service at the hotel check in is typical French arrogance with a side of Spainsh complacency. They're very unhelpful and indicitive of why the Americans just do this kind of thing better.
reviews.title: Not a four star hotel

description: The Magic Circus Hotel is situated just 10 minutes from Disneyland Paris. It offers a swimming pool, fitness room and a games room with video games. Rooms have a circus theme and views of the garden or the lake. They are equipped with a private bathroom and cable TV with children's channels. The restaurant, L'Etoile, serves traditional cuisine and regional specialties. Guests can relax in the Bar des Artistes, which features an outdoor terrace. There is also a garden with carousel. The Hotel Magic Circus offers a free shuttle service to the amusement parks. Guests can also purchase Disneyland tickets at reception. Hotel Rooms: 396. Hotel Chain: Vienna International.
